title: [Bug] Ryujinx Virtual LAN Connection
body:
### Description of the issue

My friend and I tried offsite online gaming but failed.

### Reproduction steps

We are using the same version, the game is "Clubhouse Games 51 Worldwide Classics", the online mode is "ldn_mitm", the LAN connection (yes or no) fails (no way toThe LAN connection (yes or no) fails (cannot search for each other's rooms).The network interface setting is "default" and the virtual networking tool is "n2n", we can both connect via ping.

### Log file

No log

### OS

Windows11

### Ryujinx version

1.2.81

### Game version

1.0.0

### CPU

AMD 7840H

### GPU

RTX 4060

### RAM

32gb

### List of applied mods

NO

### Additional context?

We have tested RyuLDN, it can be connected, but the network is unstable due to regional issues.
author: Malygoslight

comments.body: What you're asking for is RyuLDN, that's what LDN is. It already exists in Ryujinx, the reason you keep getting disconnected is because your internet connection isn't fast enough, we can't do anything about that.

Hi, you may have misunderstood me, what I mean is that in my tests "ldm_mitm" doesn't seem to work properly, it doesn't seem to support virtual LAN.So I'm here to ask if it's a problem with my settings or something else that prevents me from connecting properly in "ldm_mitm" mode in VLAN.

title: [Feature Request] Revert to old ryujinx logo
body:
### Overview

Please consider reverting to the previous Ryujinx logo, as the new rainbow design triggers severe eye strain for me due to a condition called photophobia, which causes sensitivity to bright or contrasting colors. The older, simpler design was much easier on my eyes and didn’t cause any discomfort, making it easier to engage with the app for longer periods. I’m sure others with similar conditions might also find the vibrant colors challenging.

### Smaller details

Revert all instances of the logo in the emulators files and on any of the services.

### Nature of request

User Health and Comfort.

### Why would this feature be useful?

Reduce eye pain for those with the condition.

title: Log .NET runtime version
body: I was looking into a crash, and found out it was an issue that was fixed in .NET 9.0.1. Since Ryujinx embeds the runtime into the executable, it not obvious which runtime a build uses. This logs the .NET runtime version immediately after the build version.
author: mattzink

comments.body:
I don't feel this is necessary. 
The contents of the repo already describe the version of .NET, and it doesn't change often.
You also can easily look at the contents of a repo as of a tag and look at the global.json file to see what version of .NET it uses, if you're using an older version and don't know what version of .NET it's on.
The global.json sets the _minimum_ required SDK version. The issue I was tracking wasn't reproducible after I compiled because I had a newer SDK locally.

I just double-checked and since there is a roll-forward policy set in the global.json and the build is using the setup-dotnet github action, then the latest 9.x.x version of the SDK will be selected/used automatically during each build. There is nothing therefore that tells someone which runtime version was embedded in a specific build.

title: [Feature Request] Automatic Controller Detection and Configuration
body:
### Overview

Ryujinx should automatically detect connected controllers, assign them to player slots (Player 1, Player 2, etc.), and set their type (e.g., PS4 controllers as Pro Controller). This eliminates manual setup for smoother usability.

### Smaller details

- Automatically detect connected controllers via USB or Bluetooth.
- Assign controllers to player slots in the order they are connected (e.g., the first controller connected becomes Player 1, the second becomes Player 2, etc.).
- Map non-Nintendo controllers (like PS4 controllers) to the Pro Controller type by default, as this is the most common use case.
- Provide an option in the settings to manually override automatic assignments if needed.

### Nature of request

Improve user experience by simplifying controller setup and configuration.

### Why would this feature be useful?

- Saves time for users who frequently switch between different controllers or play multiplayer games.
- Reduces the need for manual configuration, making Ryujinx more accessible to new users.
- Enhances the overall usability of the emulator, especially for those using non-Nintendo controllers.
author: mcpeixoto

comments.body:
The entire point of using this for playing different games with different configs should be alleviated when per-game configs gets added. Thus this would only serve to automatically do stuff a user might not want.

Don't really want this added honestly. As it is we need to stop adding settings for everything; this is turning into yuzu, and I don't want that.

title: [Feature Request] Wayland support
body:
### Overview

Support wayland to

- Decrease blur 
- Allow use of hidpi
- Better window scaling
- Improve performance

### Smaller details

Ryujinx has had some code for wayland for a while now, it would be not so bad to implement I would presume.

### Nature of request

Not urgent, just would be a qol improvement.

### Why would this feature be useful?

Let the window look less blurry under wayland.
author: inmymum

comments.body:
The logs print this on startup
```
|W| Application GetActualScaleFactor: Couldn't determine monitor DPI: Wayland not yet supported
```
ask avaloniaui

> ask avaloniaui

i answer in their behalf: ask gnome developers

> > ask avaloniaui
> 
> i answer in their behalf: ask gnome developers

yeah exactly, it's always this lol, people who ask for wayland support never realize why it's missing in the first place

I don't use gnome. Also there is a library called ```libglfw-wayland.s0.3.3``` in the ryujinx folder. Glfw has wayland support, so all it would take is making the ui support wayland to prevent the bluriness. Honestly I'm not one of those "wayland has superb security" people, I just use it because it performs better than xorg and handles displays much better. So even an implementation for something like wlr-roots would be nice

> I don't use gnome. Also there is a library called `libglfw-wayland.s0.3.3` in the ryujinx folder. Glfw has wayland support, so all it would take is making the ui support wayland.

once again i would like to reiterate, this is an avalonia issue. its not that we don't want wayland support, its that the ui framework we use doesn't support it. *and we're not going back to GTK.*

Completely fair and I agree tbh. Maybe a fork or something with gtk that is updated far less would be nice for someone like me. I don't particularly care about improvements or anything. I don't have much experience with any of these coding languages and am certaintly not saying to absolutely do this, but to maybe consider. If I had any knowhow I woild try and make a fork. I've never heard of avoliniaui and didn't know thats's what this used. I checked and there is an article from january 2 of last year which states "We are also excited to reveal an internal preview of wayland" so who knows

title: [Feature Request] Show update / game version on main panel
body:
### Overview

The main tile panel of Ryujinx should show, along with the game name, the currently installed version/update.  Today, in order to know the latest installed update we must view the game directory, or click on the game tile, and chose manage updates.  This works well, but also cannot tell at a glance the version, and overall which games are at 1.0 and which ones are updated.

### Smaller details

Show game version on main screen, along with game name.

### Nature of request

GUI enhancement

### Why would this feature be useful?

Saves user time by displaying the installed game versions, instead of examining each name individually.
author: josederas

comments.body:
we've had this suggestion before; i'm not adding new info to the grid layout because i would need to make every single bit of information togglable to keep similar to the current behavior, where the names are togglable on/off.
If you want more information, use the list view. The Grid view is for a minimalistic UI experience to those who want it, similar to the Switch app library screen.

title: [Feature Request] Storage location of the binary files (*.dll etc.)
body:
### Overview

Hello dear Ryujinx developers,

[general question]
First of all, a big compliment for taking on the further development of this project. Many very interesting functions have been added or are in the works.

I tested it briefly on my PC (Windows 11) to see how well the new functions work - it really looks promising! I used Ryujinx in portable mode. However, I noticed something that wasn't there in the original project: The storage location of the binary files (*.dll etc.) is no longer the Ryujinx folder, but is now located under ..\tmp\\.net\ryujinx\\[generic name]\..

With each update, a new folder and the same binary files are stored under this path (each over 22 mb). Is there a particular reason why the binary files are not stored in the Ryujinx folder as before?

best regards

./.

title: [Feature Request] Saves syncing to GDrive or other free service
body:
### Overview

Sync saves to GDrive or other free services.

### Smaller details

Either have a specific directory in the root of GDrive so you just have to connect in the GUI, and/or add a directory setting for it.
Saves could be simple encrypted zip files with an obfuscated name to prevent bot detection. Add a way to import/export saves as zip files. RyuJinx should sync these at startup by checking date-time of previous upload and getting/pushing the most recent files. A local backup of the last previous saves could help recover in case of bad syncing.

### Nature of request

Quality of life enhancement.

### Why would this feature be useful?

It would allow to sync various install of RyuJinx to the same set of saves.
author: Ishan333

comments.body:
This will not be implemented.
It's unfeasible to do a legit setup with Google Drive without breaking their TOS or paying a lot of money.
On top of that we don't want to be responsible for your save data.

If you want this you can download the Google Drive Desktop app and set up syncing yourself.

Unfortunately, setting the `save` folder as symlink to another folder (that will be synced by my local Nextcloud) on Linux causes the game not to load (have to check the logs) and Ryujinx to be stuck. Needed to kill the process.
Syncing just `~/.config/Ryujinx/bis/user/save` works even when sym-linked to a Nextcloud folder!

I appreciate the effort, but you removed all the locale lines that were made since approximately 1.2.0, including in the ones in the en_US.json file, which would probably cause blank lines where text should be, I would test but because of the missing lines, this PR simply does not compile.

For that reason, I am closing this PR.
OOOPS. I will re-do this PR with fresh data

title: [Feature Request] Revert to old ryujinx logo.
body:
### Overview

Please consider reverting to the previous Ryujinx logo, as the new rainbow design triggers severe eye strain for me due to a condition called photophobia, which causes sensitivity to bright or contrasting colors. The older, simpler design was much easier on my eyes and didn’t cause any discomfort, making it easier to engage with the app for longer periods. I’m sure others with similar conditions might also find the vibrant colors challenging.

### Smaller details

Revert all instances of the logo in the emulators files and on any of the services.

### Nature of request

User Health and Comfort.

### Why would this feature be useful?

Reduce eye pain for those with the condition.
author: vlxjack

comments.body: no
My apologies, we've been getting so many of these issues, that I didn't even notice that it was for a medical condition.

> The older, simpler design was much easier on my eyes and didn’t cause any discomfort, making it easier to engage with the app for longer periods.

It's a small icon in the corner of your window (if you aren't in fullscreen; which you likely would be for a longer play session).
This is not an issue.

title: [Feature Request]Flatpak Support
body:
### Overview

it will be great like similar emulator that this software can support flatpak. So, we can play it on Steam Deck

### Smaller details

release it on Flathub or hosted in different repo

### Nature of request

automated update and native support for Steam Deck console

### Why would this feature be useful?

Since, Handheld PC is booming lately and more emulators are coming to flatpak. it will be great if this software can do the same
author: dnet890

comments.body: Agree
Just so you know, you can already use Ryujinx on the steam deck without a flatpack or appimage.

I think they'd need to rename this fork to get it on flathub.
The original ryujinx is still there.

> I think they'd need to rename this fork to get it on flathub. The original ryujinx is still there.

Not necessarily. They could self host a flatpak you have to download and install like the roblox sober devs did

Frankly I can't be bothered with this. You don't need to use the flatpak to use Ryujinx on Steam Deck, etc.
It's just another thing we have to maintain for literally no reason.
Locking.

title: [Feature Request]Is the logo able changed on the GUI?
body:
### Overview

Is the logo able changed at all? I prefer old logo to this rainbow one. If not can be added?

### Smaller details

If not already, could just have logo in a folder which can be replaced with image of same size.

### Nature of request

Minor options

### Why would this feature be useful?

Customization is important as not everyone like change
author: Kureem2

comments.body: good

title: [Feature Request] A new repo for game compatibility
body:
### Overview

at the moment there is no way to know if a game is working, or how well it is working. having a dedicated repo like how it was on OG ryujinx will be helpful. 

### Smaller details

a new repo for game compatibility 

### Nature of request

having information if a new game that is released works well or not or what is the problem of games already tested

### Why would this feature be useful?

same as above
author: VeraPhobia

comments.body: i just saw the readme file too, at the moment it just says how many games works and stuff but since it doesn't link anywhere it is kind of bummer that people cant see exactly what game is playable or broken
bump
We'd have to find people who would want to manage the hundreds of issues. The old repo had a couple people like that, but now they're all gone/no longer willing to do it.

i understand but IMO having a semi organized something can be better than not having anything. and i will regret it greatly but i can help a little here and there as well and i am sure if it exist there are others who might want to help this project someway and this can be a good way

If we do do this, it would be great if we could tie it into the software itself so that it can visually indicate if a game has any bugs against it in the user interface, maybe even give a Green, Amber, Red icon on each game to show compatibility / issues.
I'm not running a game list. And I think would be unfair for me to expect other people to run it for me, for *my* fork
why did i never close this

title: [Feature Request] Scanning an amiibo from a file
body:
### Overview

An option to scan an amiibo file from your PC (file name extension .bin), allowing you to use the same amiibo in multiple emulators, and allow you to modify traits of it that are currently not possible in Ryujinx like renaming it in Smash. You do need the key_retail.bin to be in your keys folder in-order to be able to load them in the first place.

### Smaller details

Add an option for "scan from file" in the scan an amiibo window.

### Nature of request

Being able to use the same amiibo in multiple emulators and renaming it & giving it a Mii in Smash.

### Why would this feature be useful?

Allows more customization and compatibility.
author: FireRainV

comments.body: Would like to see this feature too

Don't have anything to add but I think this feature is very important for preservation. I dumped my amiibo data and have the bins saved locally for cemu/ryu use, and I noticed the latest ryu builds don't allow amiibo scanning anymore.
This feature is currently being tested on the Discord. If you'd like to help test it, your feedback would be greatly appreciated. Its located in the pr-testing forums channel.
Implemented by #412

title: [Feature Request] Add an option to force maximum GPU clocks in Vulkan
body:
### Overview

With the Vulkan renderer, in some less demanding (or specific part of) games like Zelda Link's Awakening/Mario Odyssey there are a lot of stutters, even with a relatively complete shader cache, which are partially fixed by creating a game profile for Ryujinx in AMD Adrenaline + bumping the minimum frequency clock. This was the case for my old 6750 XT and still is with my newer 7800 XT. 

This workaround is not perfect however, and stutters do still happens here and there and on some graphical effects. I doubt AMD is ever gonna bother to look into this.

### Smaller details

In Yuzu this is fixed by checking "Force Maximum Clocks (Vulkan Only)" in the graphics settings.

### Nature of request

Fix / Enhancement

### Why would this feature be useful?

Would fix stutters in less demanding games (and possibly in some others, where the GPU clocks are getting too low).
author: atari1980

comments.body: Yeah this isn't gonna happen. That option literally just makes your GPU do work on garbage data just to keep the clock speed high.
